intro: Eurotia lanata var. subspinosa, commonly known as the hairy rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and dense clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The leaves are typically covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry landscapes. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
